definition[0]: to look after someone or something
example[0]: Who’s taking care of the dog while you’re away?
example[1]: The children are old enough to take care of themselves.
definition[1]: to deal with all the necessary work, arrangements etc
example[2]: Her secretary always took care of the details.
example[3]: Don’t worry about your accommodation – it’s all taken care of.
definition[2]: to pay for something – used when you want to avoid saying this directly
example[4]: We’ll take care of the fees.
